results.title: The Case of Barbara Parsons
results.creator_credit: Rob Iveson, Parker Film Associates, Labor Canada and Morten Parker
results.brief_description: Barbara Parsons, a recent employee, is promoted to a position ahead of Michael Blais a company employee of 19 years. Dramatizes a situation that could occur in any unionized workplace - the violation of a contract between management and labour and illustrates the four main steps of the grievance procedure.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rob Iveson, Parker Film Associates, Labor Canada and Morten Parker

results.title: The Case against rubella
results.brief_description: Shows rubella-damaged children with various handicaps, including blindness and brain damage. Outlines the history of the disease and stresses that Rubella and its serious consequences can now be prevented by newly developed vaccines. Briefly shows research efforts and how the vaccines are to be used

results.title: The Carp
results.creator_credit: Maxwell Munden and Max Munden Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Anglers’ Corner”.
One of a series of films on inland water fishing in England, introduced by Bernard Venables. Shows Leslie Brewer bottom fishing for carp in a Dorset lake early one summer morning. Gives facts about the fish, where it feeds and where to find it, tackle and bait used, and how to play the catch.

results.title: The Carnot cycle and the Kelvin temperature scale
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”.
The motion of a piston in a cylinder and a moving point on a pressure-volume diagram are used in explaining the four ideal processes which constitute the Carnot cycle. Shows heat being absorbed and rejected during the cycle and defines the Kelvin scale.

results.title: The Care of the aged
results.brief_description: The problems of old people who have lived through two world wars, are often passed over by an industrial society. How do they live? Germany attempts to improve their lives by providing homes, entertainment, and other social services.

results.title: The Cardioid
results.brief_description: Illustrates the properties of the cardioid which are connected with the generation as a one-cusped epicycloid. In five parts, it deals with he double generation of the cardioid, the tangents, the normals, the evolute, and a recapitulation of these aspects. Curves mechanically drawn by Jack Peskett.

results.title: The Car man: Pininfarina
results.creator_credit: Anthony de Lotbinière, Denis Postle and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Pacemakers”.
Pininfarina, the world’s greatest name in automobile design, founder of a firm which builds 25,000 car bodies a year, and designs many others. Farina has used his uncanny feeling for the look and shape of cars to build a unique industry - an industry which is ideally suited to a comparatively small industrial nation like Italy, and which has given her a reputation unequalled in the world. Commentary written and spoken by Anthony Jay.

results.title: The car body: materials and design
results.brief_description: Summary: three alternative materials to steel for car bodies are highlighted. fully functional cars which have been made in glass reinforced plastic, wood and plastic are shown and their designers justify the use of these materials. there is a discussion
